line: ECONOMIC AND FINANCIAL STATISTICS – RESPONSE TO SUBMISSIONS ON PROPOSED CHANGES TO REPORTING CONSOLIDATION FOR SECURITISATION SPECIAL PURPOSE VEHICLES (SPVs)
label: heading

line: In May 2019, the Australian Bureau of Statistics, the Reserve Bank of Australia and the
label: paragraph

line: Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) (collectively ‘the agencies’) consulted on
label: paragraph

line: proposed changes to reporting requirements for registered financial corporations (RFCs) that
label: paragraph

line: are not a related party of an authorised deposit-taking institution (ADI). APRA proposed
label: paragraph

line: changes to the Economic and Financial Statistics (EFS) data collection relating to the
label: paragraph

line: consolidation of securitisation SPVs.
label: paragraph

line: This letter contains APRA’s response to consultation feedback. Based on the submission
label: paragraph

line: received, APRA will proceed with the proposed changes to Reporting Standard ARS 701.0
label: paragraph

line: ABS/RBA Definitions for the EFS Collection (ARS 701.0) and consequential changes to
label: paragraph

line: Reporting Practice Guide RPG 701.0 ABS/RBA Reporting Concepts for the EFS Collection
label: paragraph

line: (RPG 701.0) as outlined in May 2019.
label: paragraph

line: Background
label: heading

line: In March 2018, amendments to the Financial Sector (Collection of Data) Act 2001 (FSCODA)
label: paragraph

line: broadened the scope of entities that must register under the FSCODA and enabled APRA to
label: paragraph

line: collect information from non-ADI lenders. These amendments were made to allow APRA and
label: paragraph

line: the Council of Financial Regulators to better monitor the financial stability impacts of non-ADI
label: paragraph

line: lenders and to determine appropriate actions if needed to address a potential increase of risk
label: paragraph

line: in this sector.
label: paragraph

line: In May 2019, the agencies commenced consultation on proposed changes to the treatment of
label: paragraph

line: SPVs in the EFS data collection to improve the collection of RFC data. The agencies proposed
label: paragraph

line: changes to ARS 701.0 and consequential changes to RPG 701.0. These changes require a
label: paragraph

line: RFC that is not a related party of an ADI to consolidate the positions and transactions of all
label: paragraph

line: securitisation SPVs in a single set of reporting for EFS. These changes do not apply to a RFC
label: paragraph

line: that is a related party to an ADI.
label: paragraph

line: The assets and liabilities of securitisation SPVs would therefore be consolidated on to a RFC’s
label: paragraph

line: domestic books. Assets originated into, or transferred to, an SPV are included in the RFC’s
label: paragraph

line: reporting.
label: paragraph

line: The requirement for an external auditor’s report as set out in Standard RRS 710 Audit
label: paragraph

line: Requirements for Registered Financial Corporations – EFS collection will apply to the
label: paragraph

line: reporting RFC, and not the individual SPVs.
label: paragraph

line: Submissions received
label: heading

line: APRA received one submission from an industry body. The submission agreed that APRA’s
label: paragraph

line: proposed changes to the EFS collection were the best way to capture the bulk of the
label: paragraph

line: securitisation industry as intended. The submission noted issues to consider around the
label: paragraph

line: structure and control relationship of SPVs, and also suggested a change to reporting dates for
label: paragraph

line: RFCs.
label: paragraph

line: Structure and control of SPVs
label: heading

line: The submission indicated a number of entities may require APRA to further tailor their
label: paragraph

line: reporting requirements to cater for their unique structures. If this is the case, APRA
label: paragraph

line: encourages affected entities to contact APRA by email at DataAnalytics@apra.gov.au .
label: paragraph

line: Reporting date
label: heading

line: The submission also raised concerns regarding the due date for reporting from smaller RFCs,
label: paragraph

line: citing inconsistencies with the burden imposed on their larger peers. APRA and the agencies
label: paragraph

line: will consider this matter further and will revert at a later date.
label: paragraph

line: Reporting timeline
label: heading

line: In line with the original proposal, the first reporting period will be for the period ending July
label: paragraph

line: The agencies acknowledge that this is an abbreviated timeline. However, given the importance
label: paragraph

line: of this data, priority is being placed on commencing reporting as soon as possible. APRA
label: paragraph

line: encourages entities that have concerns with meeting the reporting timeline to contact APRA
label: paragraph

line: by email at DataAnalytics@apra.gov.au to discuss alternative reporting arrangements.
label: paragraph

line: Finalised reporting standard and guidance
label: heading

line: Copies of ARS 701.0 and RPG 701.0 are available on the APRA website at
label: paragraph

line: https://www.apra.gov.au/modernised-economic-and-financial-statistics-efs. Entities that
label: paragraph

line: require additional guidance are encouraged to contact APRA by email at
label: paragraph

line: DataAnalytics@apra.gov.au.
